metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22719 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A carefully crafted request body can cause a read to a random memory area which could cause the process to crash. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52 and earlier.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-22719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
apache2-bin - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
apache2-data - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
apache2-utils - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.48-3.1ubuntu3.3').
